<title>W3C Web Internationalization FAQ</title>     <description>W3C's Frequently Asked Questions on Internationalization</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions.html</link>     <dc:date>2004-06-03</dc:date>     <items>       <rdf:Seq>         <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-international-multilingual.html"/>         <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-ruby.html"/>       </rdf:Seq>     </items>   </channel>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-international-multilingual.html">     <title>International & multilingual Web sites</title>     <description>What is an 'international' or a 'multilingual' web site?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-international-multilingual.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-07-08</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-mono-multilingual.html">     <title>Monolingual vs. multilingual Web sites</title>     <description>What are the trade-offs between international sites that are monolingual vs. multilingual?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-mono-multilingual.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-08-21</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-doc-charset.html">     <title>Document character set</title>     <description>What is the 'Document Character Set' for XML and HTML, and how does it relate to the encodings I use for my documents?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-doc-charset.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-10-10</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-who-uses-unicode.html">     <title>Who uses Unicode?</title>     <description>Are corporate Web sites using Unicode right now? </description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-who-uses-unicode.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-07-31</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-headers-charset.html">     <title>Checking HTTP headers</title>     <description>How can I check the character encoding information sent in the HTTP header of a web document?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-headers-charset.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-06-25</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-validator-charset-check.html">     <title>Checking the character encoding using the validator</title>     <description>How can I check that the character encoding of my document is correct using the W3C HTML Validator?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-validator-charset-check.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-10-22</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-css-charset.html">     <title>CSS character encoding declarations</title>     <description>How do I declare the character encoding inside a CSS style sheet?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-css-charset.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-09-25</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-forms-utf-8.html">     <title>Multilingual form encoding</title>     <description>What is the best way to deal with encoding issues in forms that may use multiple languages and scripts?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-forms-utf-8.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-05-28</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-controls.html">     <title>HTML, XHTML, XML and control codes</title>     <description>How do I handle control codes (ie. the 'C0' U+0000-U+001F and 'C1' U+007F-U+009F ranges) in XML, XHTML and HTML?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-controls.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-06-03</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-utf8-bom.html">     <title>Unexpected characters or blank lines</title>     <description>When I'm using UTF-8 in some user agents, why do an extra line and sometimes unwanted characters appear at the top of my web page, and how     do I remove them?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-utf8-bom.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-11-27</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-setting-encoding-in-applications.html">     <title>Setting encoding in web authoring applications</title>     <description>How do I set character encoding in my web authoring applications?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-setting-encoding-in-applications.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-11-06</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-non-eng-tags.html">     <title>Non-English tags</title>     <description>Can I write HTML and XML element and attribute tag names in languages and scripts other than English?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-non-eng-tags.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-05-28</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-lang-2or3.html">     <title>2-letter or 3-letter language codes</title>     <description>Should I use two-letter or three-letter language codes?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-lang-2or3.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-08-14</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-css-lang.html">     <title>Styling using the lang attribute</title>     <description>What is the most appropriate way to associate CSS styles with text in a particular language in a multilingual XHTML/HTML     document?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-css-lang.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-08-09</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-lang-priorities.html">     <title>Setting language preferences in a browser</title>     <description>How do I check or change the language settings of my browser?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-lang-priorities.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-10-30</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-when-lang-neg">     <title>When to use language negotiation</title>     <description>When is it appropriate, or not, to use language negotiation? (available in English and     French)</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-when-lang-neg</link>     <dc:date>2004-02-26</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-apache-lang-neg.html">     <title>Apache MultiViews language negotiation set up</title>     <description>How do I use the MultiViews approach on an Apache Web server to automatically serve resources in the language requested by an HTTP     request?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-apache-lang-neg.html</link>     <dc:date>2004-01-14</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-accept-lang-locales.html">     <title>Accept-Language used for locale setting</title>     <description>Is it a good idea to use the HTTP Accept-Language header to determine the locale of the user?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-accept-lang-locales.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-09-17</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-bidi-space.html">     <title>Bidi space loss</title>     <description>Why does my browser collapse spaces between Latin and Arabic/Hebrew text?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-bidi-space.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-07-04</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-bidi-controls.html">     <title>XHMTL/HTML & bidi formatting codes vs. markup</title>     <description>To correctly format bidi text in XHTML or HTML pages, should I use Unicode control codes or markup?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-bidi-controls.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-06-19</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-bidi-css-markup.html">     <title>CSS vs. markup for bidi support</title>     <description>Should I use CSS or markup to correctly format Unicode-based bidi text in HTML and XML-based markup languages?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-bidi-css-markup.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-08-24</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-date-format.html">     <title>Displaying formatted dates</title>     <description>How do I prepare my web pages to display varying international date formats? </description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-date-format.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-06-09</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-select-sorting.html">     <title>Select box sorting</title>     <description>As part of a form, I have a list of terms in a drop-down box. Why are they not correctly sorted when I translate the items in the     list?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-select-sorting.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-05-08</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-display-capabilities.html">     <title>Display capabilities</title>     <description>Do I need to worry because display capabilities (screen sizes, number of colors, etc.) of computers vary in other countries?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-display-capabilities.html</link>     <dc:date>2004-02-06</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-scripts.html">     <title>Script direction & languages</title>     <description>What directions are commonly localized languages written in?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-scripts.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-08-12</dc:date>   </item>   <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-ruby.html">     <title>Ruby</title>     <description>What is 'ruby'?</description>     <link>http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-ruby.html</link>     <dc:date>2003-10-01</dc:date>   </item> </rdf:RDF>
